Overall, the teaching assistant for this course was accessible, organized, and able to explain concepts clearly and thoroughly.
Field trips were well designed and ran smoothly.
I learned a lot from field trips.
How clearly does the instructor provide explanations of conceptual material?
How responsive to student comments was the instructor?
I would give the instructor of this class an overall rating of:
I would give this course an overall rating of:
Apart from how well the course was taught, how valuable is the course to students with interests similar to yours?

narratives.question_text: Please identify the teaching assistant with whom you interacted most closely _____________________ .
comments: Instructor: Joseph B. Calamia  Joseph Calamia.
Instructor: Joseph B. Calamia  Joseph Calamia
Instructor: Joseph B. Calamia  Joseph Calamia
Instructor: Joseph B. Calamia  Joseph Calamia
Instructor: Lei Zhao  None
Instructor: Lei Zhao  Helpful if you go over and ask for help during lab, otherwise is just sitting on a computer and doesn't come over to help
Instructor: William Colby Tucker  Colby Tucker

narratives.question_text: What were the strengths and weaknesses of your teaching assistant
comments: Instructor: Joseph B. Calamia  My TA is pretty organized and responsible. He is helpful not only for the regular lab part, but also provided lots of useful suggestions on my final project.
Instructor: William Colby Tucker  He was great- always there and knowledgable. Also willing to ask others to help out.

narratives.question_text: Use the space below to comment on questions 1-14, if you wish
comments: Larry was able to successfully and patiently answer all of my questions during lab more than any TA.

narratives.question_text: What were the best aspects of this course?
comments: The labs were excellent, well written, and very useful.
The labs were very useful. It would help if the instructor took some time during lecture to elaborate on the labs, specifically about the use of the software.

I really enjoyed the final project, and the lab sections were helpful as well. I felt like I understand many of the tools in ENVI now, and I'd be able to learn any others if the need arose. I also liked the theoretical background taught at the beginning of the course.
The course is the most organized and logical course I have ever taken in Yale. The information is very useful, which is just awesome.

Remote sensing is an important and useful tool and the class covered a wide range of techniques. That was the best aspect of the course the breadth of issues covered in the course, which have taught me a wide range of applications.

narratives.question_text: What aspects of this course need the most improvement?
comments: Some more help with the term project would have been nice. Also a lecture or two on google earth engine seems essential considering its capabilities and the cost of ENVI.
I understand spending a few week on the physics aspect of remote sensing but I think those can be summarized in a week and we could spend more time familiarizing ourselves with Envi.
As much as I liked learning my way around ENVI, the point and click nature of the lab exercises became a little stale.

Many of the lectures are poorly organized, particularly the slides. A good set of lecture slides is independently understandable and loglical. Many of the slides are difficult to comprehend. It would be very useful to update the slides, provide more organization and flow, and define all terms used to make them better study tools and reference materials. The background information doesn't seem particularly useful as presented. I think there's too much discussion of principles without relating them to the use of the tool. The labs are too structured and don't allow room for independent thought. I learn best from labs that challenge me to think critically and solve a problem. The labs in the course are more like recipies, with some repetitive work that felt like unnecessary busywork. The labs could be improved by offering less in the way of following steps and more in the way of solving a geospatial problem using remote sensing techniques. The field trip was fun!

narratives.question_text: Was the relationship between the course lectures and discussion/lab section
comments: They fit together very well.

Spend time during lecture to go over issues during the lab. I understand that the TA is available during lab time but sometimes he was busy with other students and/or was not able to answer my questions.

I think that the final project should begin much earlier in the semester. Even if it is only a couple steps at the outset. For example, in lab 1 or 2, having a section that coerces students to retrieve an image would be helpful. This would better allow students to examine their project as they move through the lab exercises.
These were closely tied together and well managed.

narratives.question_text: Discuss, if you wish, how this course fits into your overall program.  (Please feel free to describe how the course relates to your academic background.)
comments: It was a good refresher on GIS and is very important in forestry.
I feel like I will be able to incorporate remote sensing into my thesis research after this course.
It introduced an advanced analytic skills both professionally and academically.
I am interested in learning and applying skills in geospatial analysis. This course was useful insofar as that I now know basics of remote sensing and how it can be used.

narratives.question_text: Why did you take this course?
comments: I needed to brush up on GIS and needed a quant. requirement for the MF degree.
I took the course because it is an amazing opportunity to play with fancy toys. The knowledge I gained from this introductory course far exceeded any other introductory course I have taken.
It fits well with my future career goal.

narratives.question_text: Did the knowledge/skills that you gained from the course meet your expectations ?
comments: Yes- although would have liked google included.
Yes, it was a good introduction to the use of remote sensing
The knowledge/skills gained from this course far exceeded my expectations. I am very grateful for having the opportunity to have taken the course.
the knowledge/skills that you gained from the course meet beyond my expectations.
Yes

narratives.question_text: If yes, what were the advantages and disadvantages of the group work?
comments: Nothing toshow..

narratives.question_text: For students who might consider taking this course, what advice would you give them?
comments: Take it, be ready to work hard, and reach out to the TA and professors for extra help.

This is a truly excellent course - but you should treat it as 1.5 courses (or more), as the lab is essentially its own course. Definitely take it if you have any interest in developing fluency with or an understanding of Remote Sensing - just make sure you have the time in your schedule to do so.
Just take it. Better than GIS

Be prepared to cover a wide range of material and spend a lot of time in the lab. The course is enjoyable and informative, but could benefit from labs that present more of a problem rather than a "recipe."
